definition: (coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
arrogant idler/self-centered show-off
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
grandpa/old gentleman
uncle/grandpa/CL:位[wei4]

sentences.english: The driver hastens next handlebar grandpa uprear, apologize again and again.
sentences.chinese: 司機趕忙下車把老大爺扶起，並連連道歉。

sentences.english: He went to the clinic to get some drugs for free.
sentences.chinese: 唐大爺去了趟衛生所，拿了些藥，藥是免費的。

sentences.english: You classmate is your big uncle?
Uncle Wang, who lives next door, accidentally saved a nautilus.
sentences.chinese: 隔壁的王大爺居然無意中救了一隻鸚鵡螺。

sentences.english: Sometimes a few old man to get on the car, we all rob the seats.
sentences.chinese: 不時有幾個老大爺上車，我們大家都搶着讓座。

sentences.english: The children hung about Grandpa Wang, hoping to hear a story.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們圍着王大爺，想聽他講個故事。

sentences.english: Just then an old man entered, supported by a boy.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時候，一個男孩攙着一位老大爺走了進來。

sentences.english: The young man gave up his seat to an old man.
sentences.chinese: 那年青人將座位讓給一位老大爺。

sentences.english: Uncle Wang ran on, airing his views about the cases.
sentences.chinese: 王大爺滔滔不絕地談着，發表對這案件的看法。

sentences.english: Grandpa Wang, who leads a frugal life, donated ten thousand yuan to poor children.
sentences.chinese: 一向儉約的王大爺爲貧困兒童捐獻了一萬元。

sentences.english: Grandpa Wan grew painfully aware that the family were divided in their attitude.
sentences.chinese: 萬大爺痛苦地意識到一家人的看法有分歧。

sentences.english: After attending evening classes Grandpa became more open-minded.
sentences.chinese: 老大爺上夜校以後，腦筋更開通了。

sentences.english: Who the two uncle told me NOKIA can hit the black walnut, now.
sentences.chinese: 誰他二大爺的告訴我諾基亞能砸核桃，現在黑屏了。

sentences.english: Grandpa, can I have a drink?
sentences.chinese: 老大爺，能給我口水喝麼？

sentences.english: There is an old man under that tree.
Are you related to Uncle Xu of our village?
sentences.chinese: 你和我們村的徐大爺是親戚嗎？

ma/mom/mother

Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
dick/penis (vulgar)
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
old fellow/old man/father/husband
to bully
